intro: [WRONG START] Erophila semidupplex, commonly known as the narrowleaf water primrose, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and filter water. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological and environmental studies.
